articles.headline: Documentary Draws Ire From the Church of Scientology
articles.snippet: The church says there are journalistic lapses in a documentary by Alex Gibney and it will take out ads in newspapers to raise its concerns.
articles.abstract: The church says there are journalistic lapses in a documentary by Alex Gibney and it will take out ads in newspapers to raise its concerns.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — If controversy sells, HBO may suddenly have a hit in Alex Gibney’s new documentary about Scientology and renegades who left it behind.

articles.headline: Need Some Espionage Done? Hackers Are for Hire Online
articles.snippet: No longer just the domain of intelligence agencies, “hacktivists” or criminal gangs, there is a growing cottage industry of ordinary people hiring hackers for much smaller acts of espionage.
articles.abstract: No longer just the domain of intelligence agencies, “hacktivists” or criminal gangs, there is a growing cottage industry of ordinary people hiring hackers for much smaller acts of espionage.
articles.lead_paragraph: A man in Sweden says he will pay up to $2,000 to anyone who can break into his landlord’s website. A woman in California says she will pay $500 for someone to hack into her boyfriend’s Facebook and Gmail accounts to see if he is cheating on her.

articles.headline: Perry Exits Texas Stage Making a Case for His Past, and His Future
articles.snippet: As Gov. Rick Perry prepares to leave office and contemplates another run for the White House, his record in Texas will be closely scrutinized for what it says about him and the priorities he set.
articles.abstract: As Gov. Rick Perry prepares to leave office and contemplates another run for the White House, his record in Texas will be closely scrutinized for what it says about him and the priorities he set.
articles.lead_paragraph: AUSTIN, Tex. — Gov. Rick Perry leaves office here next week not so much as a man but as the face of an era — a 14-year reign in which he became the state’s longest-serving chief executive and was widely regarded as the most powerful governor in the history of modern Texas.

articles.headline: Swiss Move Prompts Fears of Sustained Market Tumult
articles.snippet: The question now is whether the much larger players in the $5 trillion-a-day foreign exchange market might have been caught short in significant ways.
articles.abstract: The question now is whether the much larger players in the $5 trillion-a-day foreign exchange market might have been caught short in significant ways.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Swiss central bank’s surprise decision to remove the cap on its currency has incited investor fears that a spate of bank and fund losses could lead to a sustained bout of market turmoil beyond the ability of central banks to ride yet again to the rescue.
articles.byline: By Landon Thomas Jr. and Neil Gough
